titleStmt.title: A strange horse-race at the end of which, comes in the catch-poles masque. And after that the bankrouts banquet: vvhich done, the Diuell, falling sicke, makes his last will and testament, this present yeare. 1613. VVritten by Thomas Dekker.
titleStmt.author: Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Nicholas Okes] for Ioseph Hunt, and are to bee sold at his shop in Bedlem, neere Moore-field Gate,

notesStmt.note: Variant: title page partly in a different setting, with "catch-pols".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Bedlem, neere Moore-field Gate
